utility::year

utility::year Class Reference

Detailed Description

Primitive year type to take part in constructing utility::simple_date objects.

The representation of a year is a simple structure so that c++'s type system can take part in enforcing parameter ordering. For constructors this is the "WholePart" idiom, as described at http://www.two-sdg.demon.co.uk/curbralan/papers/ValuedIdioms.pdf

See also:
utility::month

utility::simple_date

Definition at line 112 of file simple_date.hpp.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

utility::year::year (  int  value  )  [explicit]
 

Create a primitive year from the provided number. No check is made for validity. When a year object is passed into the simple_date constructor, the validity check is made at that point. Therefore year objects can be any value.
